intro: Bartsia ramosa, commonly known as the clustered bartsia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a slightly hairy texture. Bartsia ramosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and grassy slopes.
